Type.Name: Selection
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: The ATK interface implemented by container objects whose children can be selected.

remarks.para: The ATK interface implemented by container objects whose children can be selected.

This should be implemented by UI components with children which are exposed by and , if the use of the parent UI component ordinarily involves selection of one or more of the objects corresponding to those AtkObject children - for example, selectable lists.
Note that other types of "selection" (for instance text selection) are accomplished a other ATK interfaces - is limited to the selection/deselection of children.

Docs.summary: Causes every child of the object to be selected if the object supports multiple selections.
Removes the specified child of the object from the object's selection.
Docs.param: A specifying the index in the selection set. (e.g. the ith selection as opposed to the ith child).

Docs.summary: Determines if the current child of this object is selected.
Docs.returns: A bool representing the specified child is selected, or 0 if selection does not implement this interface.

remarks.para: Callers should not rely on 0 or on a zero value for indication of whether AtkSelectionIface is implemented, they should use type checking/interface checking macros or the atk_get_accessible_value() convenience method.

Docs.summary: Clears the selection in the object so that no children in the object are selected.
Adds the specified accessible child of the object to the object's selection.

Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'int'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Atk.Object'

Docs.summary: Gets the number of accessible children currently selected.
Docs.value: A representing the number of items selected, or 0 if selection does not implement this interface.

remarks.para: Callers should not rely on 0 or on a zero value for indication of whether AtkSelectionIface is implemented, they should use type checking/interface checking macros or the atk_get_accessible_value() convenience method.

Docs.summary: Event raised when the selected is changed.
